item.title: Getting started with dns
item.description: Performing name lookups in C # The getaddrinfo() function is the recommended POSIX function for interfacing with the system resolver. Depending on system configuration it will perform name lookups in the DNS, /etc/hosts, mDNS, etc. It is preferred over the deprecated gethostbyname() family of functions because it supports both IPv4 and IPv6 addressing, and can also perform service name lookups at the same time (e.g. mapping http to port 80)
